column2: China's Geely cars think big with Volvo makeover GOTHENBURG
column3: Sweden The Briton who smoothed out Volvo's boxy lines and put signature radiator grilles on Lincolns for Ford is aiming to give China's Geely range global appeal by ditching its utilitarian image.

column2: Morgan Stanley CEO sticks by performance target in tough questioning PURCHASE
column3: N.Y.
column4: May 17 Morgan Stanley  Chief Executive James Gorman on Tuesday stood by his intention to reach a key performance target after facing sharp questions from an analyst about whether he can achieve the goals he laid out.

column2: Target hires Nordstrom's Mark Tritton as chief merchandising officer May 17 Big-box retailer Target Corp  appointed Nordstrom Inc executive Mark Tritton its chief merchandising officer.
Oracle co-CEO says Google caused Oracle revenue to plummet SAN FRANCISCO
column3: May 17 Longtime customers dramatically reduced the amount of licensing revenue they paid to use Oracle products after Google stole its copyrighted software to enter the smartphone market
column4: Oracle's co-chief executive Safra Catz told jurors on Tuesday.

column2: Judge agreed with U.S. regulators' qualms over Staples mergerJudge agreed with U.S. regulators' qualms over Staples merger WASHINGTON The U.S. judge who stopped Staples Inc's proposed merger with Office Depot Inc  last week agreed with antitrust enforcers that the deal would have meant higher prices for big business customers and that Amazon.com Inc's entry into office supplies would have done little to counter that.
